title: American_Top_40_1979_November_10th
description:
"We're counting down the most popular hits in the country from Bumble Bee, Arizona to Honey, California, and the countdown rolls on. Here's the first of the ten hottest records of the week; K.C. & The Sunshine Band and 'Please Don't Go'."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

The artist formerly known as John Cougar has his first top 40 hit, "I Need A Lover" (at number 39).

A listener wants to know if any number one song has ever hit number one again as a remake. Casey says it has happened three times. Twice, the songs were written by the same duo.

One band in the countdown has played on over 200 gold albums. After 27 years they are finally on the chart with their own first hit.

One singer in the countdown has been a balloon in the Macy's Thanksgiving Day parade.

There is a man in the countdown whose first album in 1961 cost only $400 to produce, and it never stopped selling.

Casey explains how many copies a hit record has to sell to hit number one and how Billboard determines that a record has hit number one. He says they use a computer.

An American Air Force couple stationed in Germany wants to know if any Germans have ever made the top 40. Casey says four German recording acts have hit the top 40 and two have made it to number one. Casey gives the details.

LW#3: Dim All The Lights - Donna Summer
LW#2: Heartache Tonight - The Eagles
LW#1: Pop Muzik - M
